course_title: Intro to Phil of Human Nature
seats: Seats: Maximum Enrollment: 20 / Seats Avail: 4Waitlist Total: 0
class_notes: What is a human? What is their nature? Am I a human? Should I conduct myself according to this nature? This class covers basic perspectives on human nature throughout history. A balance will be achieved between classical and modern, Western and non-Western, as well as humanistic and scientific perspectives.
course_description: What is distinctive about a human being? What did it mean to be a human in ancient times, as it differs from what it means in modernity? Who are we, and what are our possibilities? What can we become? The responses to these questions affect our ethics, our politics, and the meaning of our lives.
sections: Class Nbr: 1779, Section #: 1, Type: LEC, Campus: ATL, Meets: MWF 4-4:50p, Instructor: Y. Liang, Status: Open
